articles.title: Greetings to Mexican President
articles.content:
Greetings to Mexican President
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Enrique Pena Nieto, president of the United Mexican States, on the occasion of the 204th anniversary of the independence of Mexico.
					 The message wished the president and people of Mexico greater successes in the work for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Heads of Delegations of Different Countries, Int'l Organizations, Overseas Compatriots
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Heads of Delegations of Different Countries, Int'l Organizations, Overseas Compatriots 
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Tuesday met and had a talk with the heads of delegations of different countries, international organizations and overseas compatriots participating in the 9th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair.

articles.title: DPRK Olympic Committee Delegation, Players Group Leave for Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Olympic Committee Delegation, Players Group Leave for Asian Games
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The  delegation of the DPRK Olympic Committee led by Chairman Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, and  the DPRK players group led by Kim Pyong Sik, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, left here Tuesday to take part in the 17th Asian Games.

articles.title: KCNA Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
KCNA Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Korean Central News Agency led by Director General Kim Chang Gwang returned home Tuesday after visiting Mongolia.
					 It was greeted at the airport by Chon Il, vice director general of the KCNA, and Lombo Khash-Erdene, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Mongolian embassy here.

articles.title: Delegation of Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea led by Chairman Ri Myong Gil returned home Tuesday after visiting France and Mongolia.

articles.title: Delegations, Delegates, Overseas Koreans Here
articles.content:
Delegations, Delegates, Overseas Koreans Here
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of Germany, Myanmar, Brazil, China, Australia, Italy, France and other countries, a delegation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and an Iranian member of an international jury arrived here Tuesday to participate in the 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival.
					 Arriving here earlier were delegates of Sweden and UK, Koreans in the U.S., and Russian, Chinese and French members of the international jury.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 9th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Tuesday.
					 They laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK-Jordan Agreement on Air Service Signed
articles.content:
DPRK-Jordan Agreement on Air Service Signed 
 Beijing, September 15 (KCNA) -- An agreement on air service between the governments of the DPRK and the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan was signed in Beijing on Monday.
					 The agreement was signed by DPRK Ambassador to China Ji Jae Ryong and Jordanian Ambassador to China Yahya Qaralleh.

articles.title: Cuban Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Ambassador to DPRK Gives Reception
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK German Hermin Ferras Alvarez gave a reception at his embassy Tuesday on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who is also chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs,  and officials concerned.
					
					 Cuban embassy officials were present.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Reception Given for Participants in Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair
articles.content:
Reception Given for Participants in Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The organizing committee of the 9th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair hosted a reception for the participants in the book fair at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday.
					 Present there on invitation were delegations and delegates of various countries, international bodies and overseas compatriots to the book fair and staff members of foreign embassies and missions of international bodies here.
					
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairwoman of the organizing committee of the book fair, and others.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Opens
articles.content:
Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Opens
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The 9th Pyongyang International Science and Technology Book Fair opened with due ceremony at the Grand People's Study House on Tuesday.
					 Displayed there are latest science and technology books and information presented by dozens of organizations of over 20 countries and regions, including the DPRK, New Zealand, Norway, Germany, Russia, Belgium, Singapore, Switzerland and Australia, and overseas Koreans organizations, international organizations, individuals, foreign embassies and missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairwoman of the organizing committee of the book fair, Ri Ui Gu, vice-president of the State Academy of Sciences, and others.
					
					 Also on hand were delegations and delegates of foreign countries, international bodies and overseas Koreans and staff members of foreign embassies and missions of international organizations here.
					
					 The participants paid tribute to the marble statue of President Kim Il Sung at the Grand People's Study House.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk in an opening address said that the book fair is contributing to making progress and prosperity common to mankind and developing the friendly and cooperative relations among peoples of various countries of the world.
					
					 She expressed hope that the book fair would prove successful thanks to the sincere efforts and positive activities of its participants.
					
					 Vladimir Fridlyanov, president of the Russian Foundation for Humanities, who is heading its delegation, in a congratulatory speech said that the state and social attention to the field of science and technology is an important factor of guaranteeing successes in international exchange and cooperation as well as the development of the countries' science and technology.
					
					 He hoped that the book fair would contribute to building a thriving nation and developing science and technology in the DPRK.
					
					 At the end of the opening ceremony the participants went round books and information on display.

articles.title: Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair to Be Held
articles.content:
Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair to Be Held
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The 10th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair is to be held at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House from September 22 to 25.
					 The fair will bring together more than 300 trading companies of the DPRK, New Zealand, Germany, Russia, Malaysia, Mongolia, Bulgaria, Switzerland, Singapore, Algeria, Australia, Italy, Egypt, Vietnam, China, France, Cuba, Poland and Taipei of China.
					
					 To be displayed there are electronic goods, machinery and metal goods, vehicles, foodstuffs, medicines and other latest products.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Football Team Trounces Its Vietnamese Rival in Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Football Team Trounces Its Vietnamese Rival in Asian Games
						
 Inchon, September 16 (KCNA-Correspondent) -- League matches of women's football of the 17th Asian Games started.
					 11 teams were divided into 3 groups. The winner and the runner-up of each group will advance to knockout games. 
					
					 The DPRK team along with Vietnamese and Chinese Hong Kong rivals belongs to Group C. 
					
					 The DPRK team played its first game with Vietnamese rival on Tuesday. 
					
					 Kim Yun Mi of the DPRK scored the first goal in the 5th minute and the second goal in the 10th minute of the match. 
					
					 Kim Un Ju of the DPRK team scored the third goal in penalty kick in the 21st minute and Ri Ye Gyong fourth goal in the 41st minute and Jong Yu Ri fifth goal in penalty kick in the 84th minute of the match.
					
					 The DPRK trounced its Vietnamese rival 5:0.

articles.title: Top Prize Awarded to DPRK Acrobats
articles.content:
Top Prize Awarded to DPRK Acrobats
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK acrobats were awarded the top prize at the world acrobatic art festival held in Moscow.
					 The festival held from Sept. 10 to 14 brought together more than 150 famous acrobats from 16 countries including the DPRK, Russia, Germany, Mongolia, Belarus and Spain.
					
					 Aerial stunt "Conquerors" presented by DPRK acrobats was highly acclaimed by the jury and spectators for their successful stunts and flip-flaps.
					
					 At the prize-giving ceremony the gold prize, the top prize of the festival, was awarded to the DPRK acrobatic piece.
					
					 The DPRK acrobats returned home on Tuesday.

articles.title: "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Vol. 23 (Enlarged Edition) Off Press in DPRK
articles.content:
"Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Vol. 23 (Enlarged Edition) Off Press in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- "Selected Works of Kim Jong Il" Vol. 23 (enlarged edition) was brought out by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House.
					 The book contains 40 works authored by leader Kim Jong Il from December, Juche 95 (2006) to December, Juche 97 (2008).
					
					 In "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" and other works he clarified the theories on dynamically paving the road of advance for building a rich and powerful country in the era of Songun by carrying forward and developing President Kim Il Sung's idea of nation-building and the feats performed by him in building the revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 He referred to the Songun leadership feats of Kim Il Sung, the Songun revolutionary line of the Workers' Party of Korea and the validity, advantages, vitality and might of the Songun politics.
					
					 In "On Some Issues of Improving Party Ideological Work at Present", "It Is Urgent Requirement of Our Times and Our Revolution to Strengthen Socialist Education" and other works he clarified the idea that it is essential requirement for carrying out the socialist cause to give priority to the ideological work and underscored the need to intensify the ideological offensive on all fronts of the revolution and construction and conduct it energetically.
					
					 The book also contains works dealing  with theoretical and practical issues of eternally defending, carrying forward and developing the revolutionary traditions and indicating ways of directing all efforts to decisively boosting power industry, coal industry, metal industry and railway transport and improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 There are works which set forth tasks to be fulfilled to bring about a drastic change in the diet style and culture of the Korean people by developing culinary art.
					
					 The book also contains works dealing with the need for the young people to give steady continuity to the youth movement of Juche, the issue of successfully conducting the work for land management, the issue of bringing about a revolutionary turn in the educational work and the issue of rapidly developing sports science.

articles.title: DPRK: South Hwanghae Province Strives to Develop Local Industry
articles.content:
DPRK: South Hwanghae Province Strives to Develop Local Industry
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- South Hwanghae Province of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has striven to develop local industry.
					 Efforts are concentrated on boosting varieties and improving quality of consumer goods at the local factories as well as on updating their production processes.
					
					 A wave of technical innovations has been applied to making local products and detailed measures taken to supply raw materials for normal operation at factories
					
					 Setting Pongchon County as an example in remodeling locally industrial establishments, the province is now pushing ahead with the modernization drive.
					
					 An official of the South Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee told KCNA that the ongoing efforts in the province would soon produce good results in further developing local industry.

articles.title: Jangsan Sports Team in DPRK Produces Asian Champions
articles.content:
Jangsan Sports Team in DPRK Produces Asian Champions
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Jangsan Sports Team in the DPRK has produced a number of Asian wrestling champions.
					 Recently, its wrestlers Ri Kum Chol and Pak Jin Hyang bagged gold medals in men's freestyle 42 kg and women's freestyle 44 kg of the 2014 Asian Junior Wrestling Championship.
					
					 The credit for their success goes to the devoted efforts of Kim Hak Won and Kim Kyong Chol, wrestling coaches of the team.
					
					 Kim Hak Won, who trained Ri Kum Chol, works as chief wrestling coach of the team after graduating Korea University of Physical Education and Kim Kyong Chol, who trained Pak Jin Hyang, as a coach for women wrestlers after finishing his player career in the Kigwancha Sports Team.
					
					 With an ambition to produce Asian and world champions, they have devoted all their wisdom and efforts to training promising wrestlers. Thanks to their efforts, a number of wrestlers in the Jangsan Sports Team proved successful in domestic tournaments.

articles.title: DPRK Papers Blast S. Korean Regime's Confrontation Racket
articles.content:
DPRK Papers Blast S. Korean Regime's Confrontation Racket
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime staged a confrontation charade called "Inchon landing operation-a war victory celebration" in Inchon from Sept. 13 to 15.
					  Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says that the reckless farce for confrontation with the DPRK staged by the south Korean warmongers in the run-up to the 17th Asian Games in which the DPRK players group is participating is an intolerable politically-motivated provocation to it.
					
					 The commentary continues:
					
					 It was the intention of these warmongers to incite the atmosphere of confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north in the venues of the international games in a bid to obstruct the DPRK's participation in the games and, furthermore, drive the inter-Korean relations into a more catastrophic phase.
					
					 What happened in south Korea would offer sportspersons and peace-loving people of Asia an opportunity to clearly realize once again that it is the U.S. and the south Korean puppet regime that are disturbing the peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Now that the south Korean puppet regime's moves for confrontation have reached a reckless phase, the DPRK's self-restraint has reached its limit.
					
					 The improvement of the north-south relations is dearer to the north than anything else, but it cannot reach out even to those confrontation maniacs in quest of peace and reconciliation. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime would be well advised to behave with decorum, pondering over the baneful consequences to be brought by their reckless confrontation racket to the inter-Korean relations and the games.
					
					 Minju Joson in a commentary urges the south Korean puppet regime to stop its rash act, well aware of the serious consequences to be entailed by its foolish and reckless confrontation burlesque.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Anti-DPRK Acts
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Anti-DPRK Acts
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China released a statement on September 14.
					 The south Korean authorities are crying out for "building confidence", "improving relations" and resuming the north-south high-level contacts in a bid to make the public convince that they are interested in the improvement of the north-south ties, a mockery of the nation and a deception of the world, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Such hostile acts as slandering the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, scattering anti-DPRK leaflets and staging the north-targeted joint military exercises show that the south Korean authorities' hypocrisy and deception have reached the extremes.
					
					 They organize anti-DPRK plot-breeding organizations, actively instigate them behind the scene and hurl such human scum as "defectors from the north". They do not hesitate such hostile acts as inveigling vicious religious organizations of the U.S. and blocking the north-south ties from developing.
					
					 The General Association and all other Koreans in China strongly demand the south Korean authorities stop acts inciting mistrust and confrontation and opt for improving the north-south relations with sincere stand and attitude.

articles.title: Truck Accident in S. Korea
articles.content:
Truck Accident in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- South Korean KBS reported that a truck with a load of poisonous chemicals turned over to one side in Ryosu, South Jolla Province, south Korea on Sept. 13.
					 This accident left its driver dead and people nearby choked by the smell of those chemicals.

articles.title: Koreans in Germany Demand Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea
articles.content:
Koreans in Germany Demand Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany posted an article disclosing the illegality of the U.S. imperialist forces' presence in south Korea on its homepage on September 7.
					 Querying why the U.S. forces stay in south Korea, an alien land, the article continued:
					
					 The U.S. forces' occupation of south Korea was illegal from every aspect.
					
					 The U.S. fabricated the demarcation line and occupied south Korea.
					
					 It was illegal in the light of internationally recognized war regulations.
					
					  The people's committees that were organized in the southern land of the Korean peninsula took part in disarming the Japanese army and police and enforced autonomy, ensuring social stability.
					
					 Under such situation it was truly illegal for the U.S. to put south Korea under its military occupation under the pretext of "disarming the Imperial Japanese Army".
					
					 The U.S. occupation of south Korea was a trick to keep its forces there for an indefinite period.
					
					 Voices demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. forces became all the more vocal and the withdrawal of the foreign forces from the northern half of the DPRK was completed but the U.S. kept its aggression forces in south Korea under various pretexts.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Swiss Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted by Swiss Organization on Its Website 
						
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" was posted by the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on its website on Sept. 6.
					 The work, published on Sept. 5, Juche 97 (2008), clarifies in detail the idea that the DPRK's invincible might lies in defending and adhering to the Juche-oriented idea and exploits of President Kim Il Sung in the nation-building and adding shine to it forever.

articles.title: DPRK's Founding Anniversary Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Founding Anniversary Observed in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Meetings, lectures, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Benin, Nigeria, Guinea and Malaysia from Sept. 1 to 7.
					
					 Displayed there were photos documenting the revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were works of the peerless great men of Mt. Paektu and books and photos introducing the advantages and might of the DPRK's socialist system.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Pyongyang Today",  "Pyongyang at Night " and "Arms of Korea".
					
					 The chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association (Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader) who is chairman of the Beninese National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said that the DPRK covered the road of victory and glory over the past 66 years after its founding and turned into an invincible socialist power.
					
					 The chief of the Benin Group for the Study of Kimilsungism- Kimjongilism who is rector of the Cotonou Institute of Journalism of Benin said that the President wisely led the country and people, holding the top post of the DPRK for a long period.
					
					 The director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria said that the President provided ever-victorious guidelines for accomplishing the cause of independence, guided by the Juche idea and the Songun idea, set a practical example in the national liberation struggle in colonies and sincerely helped the world oppressed people in their national liberation struggle.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event held in Benin.

articles.title: Korean Book, Photo and Handicraft Exhibition Opens in Russia
articles.content:
Korean Book, Photo and Handicraft Exhibition Opens in Russia
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition opened in Obninsk City, Kaluga Region and Artyom City in the Maritime Territory, Russia on Sept. 4 and 7 on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Seen on the front walls of the venues of the exhibitions were portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Displayed there were photos documenting the exploits performed by the President in the nation-building and Songun leadership feats of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also on display there were works of the peerless great men of Mt. Paektu, books and photos introducing successes made by the army and people of the DPRK in building a thriving socialist nation and handicrafts associated with the wisdom and talents of the Koreans.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The vice-major of Obninsk City, Kaluga Region said that the DPRK which was founded and turned into an independent and prospering country by the President and Kim Jong Il is now demonstrating its might as the socialist power which is making leaping progress. thanks to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The vice-mayor of the Artyom City Administration in the Maritime Territory said that the Russia-DPRK relations are now developing at a very high level, adding:
					
					 I think that this exhibition will give the people of my city an opportunity to know well about successes made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, history and tradition of Korea and skills of the Koreans.
					
					 I hope that the Russia-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations will grow stronger.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Celebrated in Peru
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Celebrated in Peru 
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- A meeting for celebrating the 66th birthday of the DPRK took place in Lima, Peru on September 4. 
					 Seen on the front wall of the venue were portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
					
					 Personages of Peruvian political parties, organizations and institutions and masses took part in the meeting. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Peru and his embassy officials and a councilor of the Cuban embassy in Peru. 
					
					 The international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland" said that Kim Il Sung waged an arduous armed struggle to achieve the liberation of Korea and laid down a unique Juche-oriented line for nation-building, not wedded to ready-made theories, and thus founded the DPRK. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Revolutionary Socialist Party of Peru said the DPRK, though not a big country, has always won only victories in the standoff with big powers by dint of the might of unity. Really great are the exploits the leaders of the DPRK performed by setting shining examples of unity in the revolution and construction, he added. 
					
					 The chairman of the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for Study of the Juche Based Songun Policy said Korea centered on the popular masses has turned into the socialist country of Juche under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and it will continue shedding its rays as a country of Songun, socialist power as it is led by Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The chairperson of the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk said the DPRK would always emerge victorious as it is steered by sagacious leader Kim Jong Un who is firmly protecting the sovereignty of the country and socialism in the standoff with the U.S.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked in Brazil
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked in Brazil
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted on its website a special write-up illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung on Sept. 3 and 9 to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK. 
					 An article titled "Founder of DPRK" gave a detailed account of the fact that Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK, the first democratic people's state in the East, on September 9, 1948 and that he wisely led the country and its people, holding the highest post of the DPRK for a long period. 
					
					 Another article captioned "Socialist Korea, people's country" said:
					
					 The DPRK adopts all the lines and policies in reflection of the will and wishes of the people and implements in their interests. 
					
					 The 66 years covered by the DPRK were a period during which it has invariably implemented its programme. 
					
					 The people's highly civilized material and cultural life is firmly guaranteed in the DPRK. 
					
					 The DPRK is pushing forward the building of a thriving nation. Its appearance is the crystal of love for the people of leader Kim Jong Il who worked heart and soul for the building of a rich and powerful country while overcoming all sorts of sufferings and the patriotic devotion of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is carrying forward his cause. 
					
					 The DPRK, the people's country, will always prosper amid absolute support and trust of the people.

articles.title: U.S. Troops in S. Korea Chiefly to Blame for Korea's Division: British Organizations
articles.content:
U.S. Troops in S. Korea Chiefly to Blame for Korea's Division: British Organizations 
 Pyongyang, September 16 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Korean Friendship Association UK released a joint statement on September 7 on the lapse of 69 years since the U.S. troops occupied south Korea. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces present in south Korea are chiefly to blame for the division of Korea and the root cause of all sufferings and misfortunes of the Korean people. 
					
					 The 69 years since the U.S. forces' occupation of south Korea were a period which brought all sorts of misfortune to the south Korean people. 
					
					 Nevertheless, these forces are behaving in south Korea like a great monarch, enjoying extraterritorial privileges as they go  unpunished after committing all sorts of crimes such as murder, rape, robbery, drug trafficking. 
					
					 South Korea is a colony of modern version in the 21st century. 
					
					 Since their occupation of south Korea, the U.S. imperialists have staged ceaseless war drills against the DPRK, steadily escalating the tensions on the Korean peninsula and posing a grave threat to the world peace. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists should quit south Korea, taking with them all their destructive weapons and equipment and let the Korean people freely decide on their own problem and reunify the country. 
					
					 Meanwhile, British progressive organizations on September 9 made public a joint statement in support of a statement issued by the spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea which called for putting an early end to the U.S. imperialists' presence in south Korea.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang delegacion y seleccion de RPDC
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang delegacion y seleccion de RPDC
						
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Partio el dia 16 de esta capital la delegacion del Comite Olimpico de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea presidida por su presidente Kim Yong Hun, ministro de Deportes, y Kim Pyong Sik, viceministro de Deportes, para participar en los XVII Juegos Asiaticos.

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo sobre servicio aereo entre RPDC y Jordania
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo sobre servicio aereo entre RPDC y Jordania
Beijing, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 15 en esta capital el acuerdo sobre el servicio aereo entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del Reino Hachemita de Jordania.
					Lo suscribieron el embajador de la RPDC acreditado en China, Ji Jae Ryong y su homologo de Jordania en el mismo pais, Yahya Qaralleh, en representacion de sus respectivos gobiernos.

articles.title: Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por efemeride coreana
articles.content:
Embajador cubano ofrece banquete por efemeride coreana
						
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el embajador de la Republica de Cuba en Corea, German Hermin Ferras Alvarez, ofrecio el dia 16 un banquete en su sede diplomatica.
					A la recepcion fueron invitados el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Yang Hyong Sop, el presidente del Comite de Educacion y del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, Kim Sung Du, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					Participaron los miembros de la embajada cubana.
					
					En la ocasion hubo discursos.

articles.title: Inaugurada IX exposicion internacional de libros cientifico-tecnicos de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Inaugurada IX exposicion internacional de libros cientifico-tecnicos de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada el dia 16 en el Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo la IX exposicion internacional de libros cientifico-tecnicos de Pyongyang.
					En la ocasion fueron exhibidos los libros y datos de ciencia y tecnica ultramodernas, presentados por decenas de entidades de mas de 20 paises y regiones inclusive la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Nueva Zelanda, Noruega, Alemania, Rusia, Belgica, Singapur, Suiza, Australia, etc., las entidades de los coreanos residentes en ultramar, las organizaciones internacionales, las personalidades individuales y las embajadas de varios paises y representaciones de las organizaciones internacionales, acreditadas en Corea.
					
					Asistieron a la ceremonia inaugural el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, la presidenta del comite organizador de la exposicion, Kim Jong Suk, quien es presidenta del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, el vicepresidente de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, Ri Ui Gu, y otros.
					
					Ademas participaron las delegaciones de varios paises, organizaciones internacionales y los coreanos residentes en ultramar, los delegados y los miembros de las embajadas de varios paises y de las representaciones de las organizaciones internacionales en Corea.
					
					Ante todo, los participantes rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung ante su estatua de marmol erguida en el citado Palacio.
					
					En su discurso de apertura, Kim Jong Suk dijo que la feria contribuye al logro del progreso y prosperidad comunes de la humanidad y al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los pueblos de varios paises del mundo.
					
					Expreso el deseo de que la exposicion logre exitos gracias a los esfuerzos sinceros y las actividades dinamicas de los participantes.
					
					El jefe de la delegacion de Rusia, Vladimir Fridlyanov, presidente de la Fundacion Rusa para las Humanidades, dijo en su discurso de felicitacion que la atencion estatal y social a la rama de ciencia y tecnica constituye un factor principal que asegura no solo el desarrollo cientifico y tecnico del pais sino tambien el exito de intercambio y cooperacion en el ambito internacional.
					
					Expreso su esperanza de que la presente feria contribuya a la construccion de un Estado prospero y al desarrollo cientifico-tecnico de la RPDC.
					
					Terminada la ceremonia, los participantes pasaron revista a los libros y datos exhibidos.

articles.title: Acrobatas de RPDC ganan maximo premio en el festival artistico mundial de circo
articles.content:
Acrobatas de RPDC ganan maximo premio en el festival artistico mundial de circo 
Pyongyang, 16 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Los acrobatas de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea recibieron el maximo premio del festival artistico mundial de circo efectuado en Moscu, Rusia.
					En el festival transcurrido del 10 al 14 participaron mas de 150 acrobatas famosos de 16 paises, entre otros, la RPDC, Rusia, Alemania, Mongolia, Belarus y Espana.
					
					En la acrobacia aerea "Conquistadores" los acrobatas coreanos mostraron movimientos habiles arrancando efusivos aplausos del jurado y los espectadores.
					
					En la ceremonia de premiacion la acrobacia coreana recibio el premio de oro, maxima distincion del festival.
					
					Los acrobatas coreanos regresaron al pais el dia 16.
